class.name: Rope
class.description: The class renders "rope" using verlet integration. It supports using nodes as rope ends, as well as attaching the rope to other objects in a scene.

method.name: print_type
method.description: Print the type of the variant.

members.member: The number of particles that make up the rope simulation. There will be N-1 segments in the rope. The smallest number of particles you can have is 2.
Diameter of the rope. The rope caps will be scaled by this value as well.
Length of the rope. Segments will be `rope_length / rope_particles` long.
Number of sides to render the rope with. Minimum is 3. If less than 3 the rope sides will be based on the rope_width.
The rate at which the V parameter of the UV texture space repeats along the rope.

The number of subdivisions to divide the segments by. A catmull spline will be used to interpolate along the rope, increasing curvature. Switch to wireframe view to see impact of this setting on polygon count.
Framerate to run the simulation at in FPS.
When performing stiffness calculations, the number of passes through the rope to run per frame. Higher values will improve stiffness stability.
Stiffness factor. Controls stretchyness of rope. Should be around [0.8 - 1.2] for a realistic rope. Higher values may lead to instability in the simulation.
When the rope is first created, the number of simulations steps to run before rendering for the first time. Simulation will be run at `preprocess_delta` time steps.
Time step to run the pre-process simulation at when the rope is rebuilt. In seconds.
